title: How to Make Candy Turkeys

steps.headline: Insert 5 pieces of candy corn into the stuffing between 6 of the Oreos.
steps.description: Point the white tips of the candy corn down towards the cream stuffing of an Oreo. Push each candy down until the white tip isn't visible. Repeat this for each of the 6 Oreo cookies and lay them flat on a work surface. Set aside the 6 remaining Oreo cookies. These will become the bases for the turkeys. The candy corn pieces will make the feathers for your turkeys.

steps.headline: Melt the chocolate chips in the microwave.
steps.description: Put 1 cup (180 g) of semisweet chocolate chips into a microwave-safe bowl. Heat the chocolate in 15-second increments and stir it frequently until it's melted. You may need between 30 and 60 seconds total for the chocolate chips to melt.

steps.headline: Dip the mini peanut butter cups into melted chocolate.
steps.description: Take 6 miniature peanut butter cups and dip each of the large, flat sides into the melted chocolate. The chocolate will act like a glue so the cups will stick to the Oreos.

steps.headline: Attach the mini peanut butter cups to the top of the candy corn Oreos.
steps.description: Push each chocolate-dipped side onto the tops of the Oreos that have the candy corn sticking out. The mini peanut butter cups should be at the opposite side from the candy corn. These will make the chests for the turkeys.

steps.headline: Dip 6 malt balls into chocolate and set them above the mini cups.
steps.description: Take 6 malt balls, such as Whoppers or Maltesers, and lower them halfway into the melted chocolate. Then place the chocolate-dipped malt ball against the Oreo cookie where it meets the mini peanut butter cup.Variation: If you don't want to use malt balls, dip 6 mini-marshmallows in melted chocolate. Let them harden and use them in place of the malt balls. The malt balls will make the heads for the turkeys.

steps.headline: Attach the white candy corn tips to the turkey heads.
steps.description: Cut the white tips off of 6 pieces of candy corn and dip the wide ends of the white tips into the melted chocolate. Push the melted chocolate end onto the center of the malt ball. Repeat this for each of the turkeys. Discard or eat the 6 candy corn pieces that you cut. The white candy corn tips will make the beaks for the turkeys.

steps.headline: Pipe red frosting near the beaks to make the turkey wattles.
steps.description: Open 1 squeeze tube of red frosting and squirt a dab of red frosting next to each nose and down towards the bottom of the malt ball. The red frosting will form the wattles for the turkeys.

steps.headline: Open the remaining 6 Oreo cookies.
steps.description: Twist apart the remaining cookies and discard or eat the sides that don't have the cream filling. Then place the sides with the cream filling on your serving plate so the cream is facing up. Consider crushing the plain Oreo cookie sides into crumbs and using them in recipes that call for graham cracker crumbs.

steps.headline: Stand each Oreo turkey onto the flat Oreo with the cream filling.
steps.description: Take each assembled Oreo turkey with the candy and turn it vertically so the feathers are pointing up. Then push the opposite side of the cookie down into the cream filling so the turkey's head is near the base of the Oreo. Repeat this for each turkey and serve them. To store the Oreo cookie and candy turkeys, put them in an airtight container. Keep them at room temperature for up to 1 week.

steps.headline: Microwave the chocolate chips until they're melted.
steps.description: Put ½ cup (90 g) of semi-sweet chocolate chips into a microwave-safe bowl. Heat the chocolate in the microwave for 15 seconds. Then stop and stir the chocolate before microwaving it for another 15 seconds or until the chocolate is smooth. If you continue to heat the chocolate after it's melted, it will burn.

steps.headline: Spoon the chocolate into a piping bag.
steps.description: If you don't have a piping bag with a small round tip, transfer the melted chocolate to a small plastic bag. To use the plastic bag like a piping bag, snip a very small piece off of 1 corner of the bag. To save time, you can purchase a tube of chocolate frosting that's ready to pipe.

steps.headline: Attach 8 mini cups on top of 8 full-size cups using the melted chocolate.
steps.description: Pipe a little of the melted chocolate onto the back of each mini peanut butter cup. Then push the frosted back onto the top of a full-size peanut butter cup. Put the mini cup near the edge of a full-size cup so the edges line up.Tip: If you want to be able to stand the candy turkeys up easily, use a sharp knife to shave off just a little of the chocolate cups where they line up.

steps.headline: Place 2 googly eyes onto each mini peanut butter cup.
steps.description: Get out 16 candy googly eyes and pipe a dot of melted chocolate onto the back of each. Then put 2 candy googly eyes onto each mini peanut butter cup. You can find candy googly eyes near the frosting and sprinkles in the baking aisle of the grocery store.

steps.headline: Pipe chocolate across each full-size cup and press on 5 Reese's Pieces.
steps.description: Pipe some of the melted chocolate along the top half of each full-size peanut butter cup. Push 5 Reese's Pieces candies onto each full-size cup to make the feathers. Alternate the yellow and orange colors as you go.Variation: If you prefer to have feathers that stick out of the cups, use candy corn pieces instead of Reese's Pieces candies.

steps.headline: Pipe chocolate onto an orange candy and place it under the googly eyes.
steps.description: To make the turkey's nose, pipe a dot of chocolate onto the side of an orange Reese's Pieces candy. Then push it into place directly under the googly eyes on the mini-peanut butter cup. Repeat this for each turkey.

steps.headline: Serve the candy turkeys once the chocolate hardens.
steps.description: Let the turkeys set up for about 5 minutes so the chocolate holds the edible candies in place. Then place the candy turkeys on a serving platter. You can store the candy turkeys in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 week.

tyn: Piping bag with a small tip or a plastic bag
text: Oreo Cookie and Candy Turkeys Insert 5 pieces of candy corn into the stuffing between 6 of the Oreos. Point the white tips of the candy corn down towards the cream stuffing of an Oreo. Push each candy down until the white tip isn't visible. Repeat this for each of the 6 Oreo cookies and lay them flat on a work surface. Set aside the 6 remaining Oreo cookies. These will become the bases for the turkeys. The candy corn pieces will make the feathers for your turkeys. Melt the chocolate chips in the microwave. Put 1 cup (180 g) of semisweet chocolate chips into a microwave-safe bowl. Heat the chocolate in 15-second increments and stir it frequently until it's melted. You may need between 30 and 60 seconds total for the chocolate chips to melt. Dip the mini peanut butter cups into melted chocolate. Take 6 miniature peanut butter cups and dip each of the large, flat sides into the melted chocolate. The chocolate will act like a glue so the cups will stick to the Oreos. Attach the mini peanut butter cups to the top of the candy corn Oreos. Push each chocolate-dipped side onto the tops of the Oreos that have the candy corn sticking out. The mini peanut butter cups should be at the opposite side from the candy corn. These will make the chests for the turkeys. Dip 6 malt balls into chocolate and set them above the mini cups. Take 6 malt balls, such as Whoppers or Maltesers, and lower them halfway into the melted chocolate. Then place the chocolate-dipped malt ball against the Oreo cookie where it meets the mini peanut butter cup.Variation: If you don't want to use malt balls, dip 6 mini-marshmallows in melted chocolate. Let them harden and use them in place of the malt balls. The malt balls will make the heads for the turkeys. Attach the white candy corn tips to the turkey heads. Cut the white tips off of 6 pieces of candy corn and dip the wide ends of the white tips into the melted chocolate. Push the melted chocolate end onto the center of the malt ball. Repeat this for each of the turkeys. Discard or eat the 6 candy corn pieces that you cut. The white candy corn tips will make the beaks for the turkeys. Pipe red frosting near the beaks to make the turkey wattles. Open 1 squeeze tube of red frosting and squirt a dab of red frosting next to each nose and down towards the bottom of the malt ball. The red frosting will form the wattles for the turkeys. Open the remaining 6 Oreo cookies. Twist apart the remaining cookies and discard or eat the sides that don't have the cream filling. Then place the sides with the cream filling on your serving plate so the cream is facing up. Consider crushing the plain Oreo cookie sides into crumbs and using them in recipes that call for graham cracker crumbs. Stand each Oreo turkey onto the flat Oreo with the cream filling. Take each assembled Oreo turkey with the candy and turn it vertically so the feathers are pointing up. Then push the opposite side of the cookie down into the cream filling so the turkey's head is near the base of the Oreo. Repeat this for each turkey and serve them. To store the Oreo cookie and candy turkeys, put them in an airtight container. Keep them at room temperature for up to 1 week. Peanut Butter Cup Turkeys Microwave the chocolate chips until they're melted. Put ½ cup (90 g) of semi-sweet chocolate chips into a microwave-safe bowl. Heat the chocolate in the microwave for 15 seconds. Then stop and stir the chocolate before microwaving it for another 15 seconds or until the chocolate is smooth. If you continue to heat the chocolate after it's melted, it will burn. Spoon the chocolate into a piping bag. If you don't have a piping bag with a small round tip, transfer the melted chocolate to a small plastic bag. To use the plastic bag like a piping bag, snip a very small piece off of 1 corner of the bag. To save time, you can purchase a tube of chocolate frosting that's ready to pipe. Attach 8 mini cups on top of 8 full-size cups using the melted chocolate. Pipe a little of the melted chocolate onto the back of each mini peanut butter cup. Then push the frosted back onto the top of a full-size peanut butter cup. Put the mini cup near the edge of a full-size cup so the edges line up.Tip: If you want to be able to stand the candy turkeys up easily, use a sharp knife to shave off just a little of the chocolate cups where they line up. Place 2 googly eyes onto each mini peanut butter cup. Get out 16 candy googly eyes and pipe a dot of melted chocolate onto the back of each. Then put 2 candy googly eyes onto each mini peanut butter cup. You can find candy googly eyes near the frosting and sprinkles in the baking aisle of the grocery store. Pipe chocolate across each full-size cup and press on 5 Reese's Pieces. Pipe some of the melted chocolate along the top half of each full-size peanut butter cup. Push 5 Reese's Pieces candies onto each full-size cup to make the feathers. Alternate the yellow and orange colors as you go.Variation: If you prefer to have feathers that stick out of the cups, use candy corn pieces instead of Reese's Pieces candies. Pipe chocolate onto an orange candy and place it under the googly eyes. To make the turkey's nose, pipe a dot of chocolate onto the side of an orange Reese's Pieces candy. Then push it into place directly under the googly eyes on the mini-peanut butter cup. Repeat this for each turkey. Serve the candy turkeys once the chocolate hardens. Let the turkeys set up for about 5 minutes so the chocolate holds the edible candies in place. Then place the candy turkeys on a serving platter. You can store the candy turkeys in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 week.
sentences: Oreo Cookie and Candy Turkeys Insert 5 pieces of candy corn into the stuffing between 6 of the Oreos.
Point the white tips of the candy corn down towards the cream stuffing of an Oreo.
Push each candy down until the white tip isn't visible.
Repeat this for each of the 6 Oreo cookies and lay them flat on a work surface.
Set aside the 6 remaining Oreo cookies.
These will become the bases for the turkeys.
The candy corn pieces will make the feathers for your turkeys.
Melt the chocolate chips in the microwave.
Put 1 cup (180 g) of semisweet chocolate chips into a microwave-safe bowl.
Heat the chocolate in 15-second increments and stir it frequently until it's melted.
You may need between 30 and 60 seconds total for the chocolate chips to melt.
Dip the mini peanut butter cups into melted chocolate.
Take 6 miniature peanut butter cups and dip each of the large, flat sides into the melted chocolate.
The chocolate will act like a glue so the cups will stick to the Oreos.
Attach the mini peanut butter cups to the top of the candy corn Oreos.
Push each chocolate-dipped side onto the tops of the Oreos that have the candy corn sticking out.
The mini peanut butter cups should be at the opposite side from the candy corn.
These will make the chests for the turkeys.
Dip 6 malt balls into chocolate and set them above the mini cups.
Take 6 malt balls, such as Whoppers or Maltesers, and lower them halfway into the melted chocolate.

Then place the chocolate-dipped malt ball against the Oreo cookie where it meets the mini peanut butter cup.Variation: If you don't want to use malt balls, dip 6 mini-marshmallows in melted chocolate.
Let them harden and use them in place of the malt balls.
The malt balls will make the heads for the turkeys.
Attach the white candy corn tips to the turkey heads.
Cut the white tips off of 6 pieces of candy corn and dip the wide ends of the white tips into the melted chocolate.
Push the melted chocolate end onto the center of the malt ball.
Repeat this for each of the turkeys.
Discard or eat the 6 candy corn pieces that you cut.
The white candy corn tips will make the beaks for the turkeys.
Pipe red frosting near the beaks to make the turkey wattles.
Open 1 squeeze tube of red frosting and squirt a dab of red frosting next to each nose and down towards the bottom of the malt ball.
The red frosting will form the wattles for the turkeys.
Open the remaining 6 Oreo cookies.
Twist apart the remaining cookies and discard or eat the sides that don't have the cream filling.
Then place the sides with the cream filling on your serving plate so the cream is facing up.
Consider crushing the plain Oreo cookie sides into crumbs and using them in recipes that call for graham cracker crumbs.
Stand each Oreo turkey onto the flat Oreo with the cream filling.
Take each assembled Oreo turkey with the candy and turn it vertically so the feathers are pointing up.
Then push the opposite side of the cookie down into the cream filling so the turkey's head is near the base of the Oreo.
Repeat this for each turkey and serve them.
To store the Oreo cookie and candy turkeys, put them in an airtight container.
Keep them at room temperature for up to 1 week.
Peanut Butter Cup Turkeys Microwave the chocolate chips until they're melted.
Put ½ cup (90 g) of semi-sweet chocolate chips into a microwave-safe bowl.
Heat the chocolate in the microwave for 15 seconds.
Then stop and stir the chocolate before microwaving it for another 15 seconds or until the chocolate is smooth.
If you continue to heat the chocolate after it's melted, it will burn.
Spoon the chocolate into a piping bag.
If you don't have a piping bag with a small round tip, transfer the melted chocolate to a small plastic bag.
To use the plastic bag like a piping bag, snip a very small piece off of 1 corner of the bag.
To save time, you can purchase a tube of chocolate frosting that's ready to pipe.
Attach 8 mini cups on top of 8 full-size cups using the melted chocolate.
Pipe a little of the melted chocolate onto the back of each mini peanut butter cup.
Then push the frosted back onto the top of a full-size peanut butter cup.

Put the mini cup near the edge of a full-size cup so the edges line up.Tip: If you want to be able to stand the candy turkeys up easily, use a sharp knife to shave off just a little of the chocolate cups where they line up.
Place 2 googly eyes onto each mini peanut butter cup.
Get out 16 candy googly eyes and pipe a dot of melted chocolate onto the back of each.
Then put 2 candy googly eyes onto each mini peanut butter cup.
You can find candy googly eyes near the frosting and sprinkles in the baking aisle of the grocery store.
Pipe chocolate across each full-size cup and press on 5 Reese's Pieces.
Pipe some of the melted chocolate along the top half of each full-size peanut butter cup.
Push 5 Reese's Pieces candies onto each full-size cup to make the feathers.
Alternate the yellow and orange colors as you go.Variation: If you prefer to have feathers that stick out of the cups, use candy corn pieces instead of Reese's Pieces candies.
Pipe chocolate onto an orange candy and place it under the googly eyes.
To make the turkey's nose, pipe a dot of chocolate onto the side of an orange Reese's Pieces candy.
Then push it into place directly under the googly eyes on the mini-peanut butter cup.
Repeat this for each turkey.
Serve the candy turkeys once the chocolate hardens.
Let the turkeys set up for about 5 minutes so the chocolate holds the edible candies in place.
Then place the candy turkeys on a serving platter.
You can store the candy turkeys in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 week.
